resources.string: Tap the lemon tree to select a lemon
Keep tapping the lemon to squeeze it
Tap the lemonade to drink it
Tap the empty glass to start again
The sea and sky, endless and serene
Mountains that tell stories of strength
Rugged peaks reaching for the sky
Whispers of the wind among the giants
Mimics the light and night to blend in
Harnesses the power of canary to develop bravely
Effortlessly glides in to save the day
Ability to shift to any form and energize
Put some time on your calendar to take a walk outside or even take a meeting while strolling through your neighborhood.
Listen to a new podcast or audiobook
Listen to a podcast and explore a topic you’ve been itching to learn more about or discover a new genre of content.
Start your day with a glass of water and aim to drink at least 8 glasses throughout the day to stay hydrated.
Choose one small area like your desk, a drawer, or your bag and tidy it up for a clear mind and clear space.
Find a quiet space, sit comfortably, and try a short guided meditation to calm your mind and focus.
Write down three things you’re grateful for
Reflect on the positives in your life and write them down to boost your mood and perspective.
Take 5–10 minutes to stretch your arms, legs, and back. Focus on areas where you feel the most tension.
Reach out to someone you care about and check in. A small chat can brighten both your days.
Prepare a meal at home using fresh, nutritious ingredients. Cooking can be relaxing and rewarding.
Pick a book or article that interests you and spend some quiet time immersed in it.
Turn off notifications and take a break from your phone or computer for at least an hour.
Do a random act of kindness
Help someone out or offer a small gesture of kindness—it could be as simple as a compliment or holding the door open.
Spend 10 minutes writing about your day, your feelings, or your goals. It’s a great way to process and reflect.
Explore something you’ve always wanted to try, like painting, baking, or playing an instrument.
Take a few minutes to focus on slow, deep breaths to relax your mind and body.
Schedule time to do things you love, whether it’s a spa day, watching movies, or taking a long nap.
Go for a walk in nature
Visit a park, garden, or trail to connect with nature and enjoy some fresh air.
Organize your email inbox, clear out unused apps, or declutter your photo gallery for a digital refresh.
Watch an inspiring video or talk
Find a TED Talk or motivational video that uplifts and inspires you to think bigger.
Try a new workout or activity
Experiment with yoga, cycling, or a dance class. A new workout can energize and excite you.
Create a playlist of your favorite songs or discover new music that matches your mood.
Focus on one task at a time
Pick one important task and work on it without multitasking for better focus and efficiency.
Write a letter to your future self
Imagine where you want to be in a year and write a heartfelt letter with encouragement and goals.
Write about moments or people you’re thankful for. A consistent gratitude practice can bring more positivity.
Watch a tutorial or read about a topic you’ve been curious about—it could be anything from cooking to coding.
Spend time reviewing your budget, savings, or goals. Financial wellness is a big part of self-care.
Repeat uplifting affirmations like “I am capable” or “I am enough” to boost confidence.
Doodle, paint, or write something creative without worrying about the outcome—it’s just for fun.
Enjoy your meals slowly, savoring every bite. Pay attention to flavors and textures for a more satisfying experience.
Look back on your 30-day journey and plan the next steps to keep the momentum going.
